class.rdfs:comment: The cost per unit of a medical drug. Note that this type is not meant to represent the price in an offer of a drug for sale; see the Offer type for that. This type will typically be used to tag wholesale or average retail cost of a drug, or maximum reimbursable cost. Costs of medical drugs vary widely depending on how and where they are paid for, so while this type captures some of the variables, costs should be used with caution by consumers of this schema's markup.
class.rdfs:label: DrugCost

schema:applicableLocation.rdfs:comment: The location in which the status applies.
schema:applicableLocation.rdfs:label: applicableLocation

schema:costCategory.rdfs:comment: The category of cost, such as wholesale, retail, reimbursement cap, etc.
schema:costCategory.rdfs:label: costCategory

schema:costCurrency.rdfs:comment: The currency (in 3-letter of the drug cost. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217
schema:costCurrency.rdfs:label: costCurrency

schema:costOrigin.rdfs:comment: Additional details to capture the origin of the cost data. For example, 'Medicare Part B'.
schema:costOrigin.rdfs:label: costOrigin

schema:costPerUnit.rdfs:comment: The cost per unit of the drug.
schema:costPerUnit.rdfs:label: costPerUnit

schema:drugUnit.rdfs:comment: The unit in which the drug is measured, e.g. '5 mg tablet'.
schema:drugUnit.rdfs:label: drugUnit
